title: 'Do you want me to hit you again?' Burger King employee alleges assault by manager
text:
Dad jailed for suffocating his toddler daughter 'Do you want me to hit you again?' Burger King employee alleges assault by manager MAHVASH ALI Last updated 12:46, February 22 2017 SUPPLIED 
Abby O'Brien alleges she was assaulted by her manager at Burger King, Lincoln Rd. 
A Burger King employee claims she was hit on the back of her head by her boss. 
Abby O'Brien,18, said she has been working at the fast food chain's Lincoln Rd branch since September 2015 and alleged she was assaulted on February 19. 
In a statement to police O'Brien said the assault occurred after she checked the temperature in the outlet's kitchen with a borrowed temperature gauge because she suspected the air conditioning was not working. Mahvash Ali 
A Burger King Lincoln Rd employee claims she was physically assaulted in front of other employees. 
A press release by Unite Union said workers at the west Auckland Burger King "were being forced to work in 33 degree heat and been refused breaks for up to five hours as the drive through backed up". 
O'Brien said one of the managers tried to snatch the temperature gauge from her. 
She said in the statement she refused to hand over the gadget. Mahvash Ali 
The company that owns Burger King Lincoln Rd says the assault allegation is being taken seriously. 
O'Brien said another manager then started pushing her out of the kitchen until she reached the counter. 
"[The other manager] smacked me in the back of my head with one of her hands." 
The employee claimed the manager threatened her when she turned around after being struck. 
"She said 'do you want me to hit you again?'" 
Unite Union organiser Gary Carnston said he was present in the lobby at the front of the store when the alleged incident took place. 
He accompanied O'Brien to Henderson police station to report the matter. 
Carnston said a complaint had been made to Burger King management about the issue and he understands that the accused manager had "been moved on" from the Lincoln Rd store. 
James Woodbridge, general manager marketing of Antares Restaurant Group which owns Burger King Lincoln Rd, said the is an employment relations issue and is under investigation. 
He said the company is taking the allegation seriously. 
"We are talking to the employees concerned." 
O'Brien said this is her first job and she doesn't understand why this has happened to her. - Stuff
